title: Microbiological and Genomic Strategies for Testing Across Diverse Applications | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: This course covers the foundational principles and latest technologies of microbiological and genomic methods for applications in food safety, water quality testing, environmental monitoring and sterility testing.

text_lines: Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Microbiological and Genomic Strategies for Testing Across Diverse Applications
Microbiological and Genomic Strategies for Testing Across Diverse Applications

This course covers the foundational principles and latest technologies of microbiological and genomic methods for applications in food safety, water quality testing, environmental monitoring and sterility testing.
Reliable microbial testing methods play a fundamental role in safeguarding food and water safety, environmental monitoring and ensuring quality control in pharmaceuticals.

This course aims to equip professionals across diverse sectors with updated knowledge and hands-on learning opportunities involving microbiological, mass spectrometric and genomic methods for microbial testing.

Over three days, you will gain practical lab-based training in fundamental microbiological testing techniques that comply with both international and local testing benchmarks. The course covers conventional microbiological methods such as culturing, gram-staining and microscopy. Additionally, it includes molecular techniques such as PCR, which is routinely used to maintain rigorous safety standards in various industries.

Beyond foundational techniques, the course introduces you to advanced genomic and bioanalytical methodologies essential for meeting stringent standards mandated by professional bodies. You will have hands-on opportunities to learn and experience microbial enumeration and classification using MALDI-TOF mass spectrometry (MS) and Oxford Nanopore Sequencing.

Ultimately, this course aims to hone the skills of practitioners in cutting-edge microbiological and genomic techniques, crucial for robust microbial testing. It plays a vital role in nurturing a resilient workforce dedicated to upholding public health.
Professionals working in food industry (Food manufacturing and food safety)
Professionals from third party test laboratories
Quality control professionals in pharmaceutical industry
Agencies and authorities working in food and environmental safety
Professionals working in roles related to microbial-related laboratory courses at tertiary institutions
Basic microbiology and molecular biology lab skills
Microbiological methods to meet microbial testing standards (FDA-BAM, ISO standards, APHA and USP-NF methods)
Biochemical methods to meet microbial testing standards (FDA-BAM, ISO standards, APHA and USP-NF methods)
Advanced genomic methods for microbiological profiling
Associate Professor,  Food, Chemical and Biotechnology, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor,  Food, Chemical and Biotechnology, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Joy Pang is an Associate Professor from the Food, Chemical, and Biotechnology cluster at SIT. Her educational background is in microbiology and biochemistry, and her academic interest lies in the field of bioanalytics. Dr Pang has used advanced chromatography and high-throughput sequencing methods to explore the chemical biology of RNA modifications and their impact on bacterial pathogenesis.
Associate Professor,  Food, Chemical and Biotechnology, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor,  Food, Chemical and Biotechnology, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr Ryan Tay is an Associate Professor from the Food, Chemical and Biotechnology cluster at SIT. He majors in microbiology, food safety and microbiological testing methods. He specialises in testing methods on microorganisms in accordance to the FDA BAM, ISO, APHA and USP-NF methodologies. In the microbial detection and identification methodologies, he teaches the usage of fundamental, enrichment, selective and differential media culturing methods with confirmation of using biochemical, molecular and serological methods.
Senior Professional Officer, Singapore Institute of Technology
Senior Professional Officer, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr Ng Chow Goon is a Senior Professional Officer from Professional Officer Division.  Her educational background is on clinical and environmental microbiology and her academic interests lie in pathogen identification, detection and epidemiological surveillance, and utilisation of beneficial microorganisms for agricultural usage and food production.
A Certificate of Attainment will be issued to participants who
Attend at least 75% of the course; and
Undertake and pass non-credit bearing assessment during the course
Participants who meet the attendance requirement but do not pass the assessment will receive a Certificate of Participation.
The full fee for this course is S$ 3,815.00
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.

Towards Food Innovation, One Small Batch at a Time

Jointly launched by SIT, Enterprise Singapore and JTC in April 2022, FoodPlant, Singapore’s first shared facility for small-batch food production, has garnered interest from various food manufacturing players. One of them is SGProtein, a Singapore-based meat analogue manufacturer, who has partnered SIT and FoodPlant since 2021 through a series of student projects, Continuing Education & Training (CET) courses and manufacturing collaborations.
In a world shaped by constant disruption, lifelong learning is pivotal in nurturing innovative and adaptive workers, enhancing economic competitiveness and quality of life.
Explore the fundamentals of fire engineering science and its role in analysing fire behaviour, heat transfer, and fluid dynamics in complex built environments.
Graduate Certificate in Fire Dynamics and Fire Modelling
District Cooling Systems: Technologies, Components, and Sustainable Engineering
Learn the fundamentals of district cooling systems, including technologies, engineering principles, and sustainability strategies, to optimise efficiency and minimise environmental impact.
Sustainability, Energy Efficiency, Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering
CHE6031N01 Process Safety Management and KPIs
Learn about effective Process Safety Management systems and associated performance measurement to ensure safe plant operations.
Graduate Certificate in Process Safety Management and Engineering Design
Next-Generation Food Innovation: Texture Development and Advanced Rheology
Learn theory in mechanics, rheology and biopolymer chemistry. Gain hands-on experience in extrusion basics and texturing a formulation using high-moisture or low-moisture extrusion.
CHE6031N02 Permit to Work for Management
This course delves into the operations and compliance measures of the Permit to Work (PTW) system, enhancing control over high-risk tasks and ensuring workplace safety.
Graduate Certificate in Process Safety Management and Engineering Design
This course covers RAM theory and its application across industries to assess system performance and efficiency, thereby enhancing system availability.
Graduate Certificate in Process Safety Management and Engineering Design

Jointly launched by SIT, Enterprise Singapore and JTC in April 2022, FoodPlant, Singapore’s first shared facility for small-batch food production, has garnered interest from various food manufacturing players. One of them is SGProtein, a Singapore-based meat analogue manufacturer, who has partnered SIT and FoodPlant since 2021 through a series of student projects, Continuing Education & Training (CET) courses and manufacturing collaborations.
